content:
Hello there We have read that question

На эту последнюю учетную запись, которую вы создали, придет сообщение: предупреждение о том, что вы явно не удалили все части этой старой учетной записи в предыдущей учетной записи, поэтому на вашем компьютере есть дубликаты, которые следует удалить в первую очередь и только потом вы можете установить новую копию программного обеспечения.

Сначала попробуйте стереть новую учетную запись и попытайтесь удалить все части, которые содержат ваш компьютер, из этих старых частей и новых, вы думаете о программе для очистки вашего ПК. После этого вы укрепляете свою среду с помощью низкоуровневого антивируса. После этого вы можете снова установить новую версию.

Проверяет, не ввели ли вы неверные настройки в настройках сервера после повторного создания учетной записи. (Настройки SMTP).

В этих действиях вы можете увидеть, сможете ли вы все еще найти небольшие части старого аккаунта на вашем ПК. Программное обеспечение, которое вы используете, также может мешать его отключению, если оно противоречит нашему программному обеспечению.

content:
Can you please supply info as follows:

  • What OS are you using ?
  • What version of Thunderbird are you using?
  • Are you talking about a Pop or IMAP account?
  • What are the server settings you are using for the aol account?
  • Upload images of Account Settings > Server Settings and also the SMTP settings.

regarding the aol pop up that comes up on the screen: Please upload an image of that pop up so we know what you are talking about.

regarding the issue: often they seem blocked in the system or fail to send. Do you get an error message ? If yes, upload an image of the error message or type the error message Word for word verbatim.

regarding : In addition all my emails are on the thunderbird and would like to remove all the aol mails but cannot find out how to do this?

Are you really sure you want to do this? The issues regarding sending and error messages seem to impy that you just want to try and get the accoutn working properly.

When you say 'remove' that has various implecations. Do you mean you have an aol Imap account, so emails are stored on server and at same time displayed in the aol imap account in Thunderbird and want to remove all emails off the server, but keep them handy in the Thunderbird 'Local Folders' account just in case you need them?

Do you mean you have a load of emails which you just do not want at all and have a need to completely destroy all the aol emails ? Do you have a copy of all emails still on the server as seen via webmail ? Do you want all aol emails to be removed off the server?

If you have an Imap account and you remove/delete all emails in the aol imap account then this will also delete all emails off the server. If you have a Pop mail account then all emails are stored on your computer. Deleting of emails may occur on the server depending upon settings.

I just want to you to be aware of the action you seem to wanting to perform.

To delete all emails in a folder:

  • Select folder eg: Inbox
  • Select an email in the Message List to get focus on the list.
  • Use keyboard 'Ctrl+A' to select and highlight all emails in that folder.
  • They get listed as 'X number of conversations' and a 'Delete' button will appear
  • click on the Delete button and this will delete all emails in the 'Inbox'
  • Then right click on Inbox and select 'Compact' and this will remove all traces of emails in that folder, so wiping clean the mbox file that stores them.
  • Right click on 'Trash' and select 'Empty Deleted'

Repeat the above process for each folder where you want to delete all emails.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Regarding ' REmove emails':

Are you wanting to 'Remove' the aol account? If you have an Imap account then emails are still on server, you you could create a new imap account and get them all downloaded again.

If you have a Pop mail account, then it is possible to remove the account, but still keep all emails in the profile. By default, just removing the pop account from Thunderbird does not delete all the account emails from the profile as Thunderbird realises it is possible this is your only copy of emails as it is assumed downloading to a pop account physically pops emails off server upon download. It's basically a backup failsafe method just in case you remove the account in error and suddenly need to recover it.

Mail accounts are removed via the Account Settings. DEpending upon the version you use, the Remove Account button will appear top right Otherwise, select account and click on 'Account Actions' and select 'Remove account'

Prova ad avviare Thunderbird in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird

Se il pulsante Nuovo messaggio non funziona neppure in questa modalità, è possibile che si sia corrotto il profilo di Thunderbird e l'unica alternativa è ripartire da zero -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-piu-profili#w_creare-un-profilo

creator: kmz5w7f4rt

content:
Il nuovo profilo si affianca a quello attuale e puoi passare dall'uno all'altro ogni volta che vuoi.

Tuttavia bisogna tenere conto di alcune cose: - se usi IMAP per leggere l posta, puoi scaricarla su entrambi i profili senza grossi problemi - se invece usi POP3 la nuova posta la scaricherai solo sul profilo che si collega per primo e quindi rischi di spezzare l'archivio in due parti

In generale quindi se con il nuovo profilo tutto funziona, ti converrà migrare la vecchia posta sul nuovo profilo e poi eliminare quello vecchio. In caso ne riparliamo ma di base si procede come descritto qui -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Importare+mbox.-

content:
Kedves Vera!

Ez alapvetően nem a Thunderbird (meg úgy általában bármilyen levelezőkliens) dolga lenne, bár megoldható vele. Mindenesetre első körben a szolgáltatónál kopogtatnék, hogy tudnak-e archiválást biztosítani.

A Thunderbirdben két lehetőség kínálkozik:

  • Készíthetsz biztonsági másolatot az egész profilodról. Ez biztonsági tartaléknak nem rossz (arra mindenképp érdemes eltenni!), de én átköltöztetéshez mégsem ajánlanám, mert kézileg át kell helyezni a leveleket az új postafiókba (vagy egy helyi mappába). A profil alapesetben Windowson a C:\Users\[felhasználónév]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ mappában található.
  • Használhatod az ImportExportTools NG kiegészítőt, amellyel többféle formátumba tudod exportálni a leveleidet, illetve azokból importálhatod is. Az ilyen szolgáltatásváltásokhoz az mbox formátumot ajánlom, ezzel egyetlen fájlba exportálhatod az összes leveledet, melyet aztán egyszerűen importálhatsz.

A címjegyzékeket és a naptárbejegyzéseket közvetlenül a Thunderbirdből tudod exportálni.

  • A naptáraknál kattints jobb gombbal az egyes naptárakra, majd válaszd a Naptár exportálása lehetőséget. A kapott .ics fájlt számos program tudja kezelni, illetve természetesen a Thunderbirdbe is importálható
  • A címjegyzékeknél kattints jobb gombbal az egyes címjegyzékekre, majd válaszd az Exportálás lehetőséget. Mind a négy exportálási formátum importálható is a Thunderbirdbe. Talán az LDIF a legbiztosabb választás, de jó eséllyel mindegyik megfelelő.

Üdv, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: I did like described and it worked great! I found the backup and restore tool and that worked partially, but this was perfect! Thank you David! Regards, Gerhard

content:
You are very welcome. As a reminder for the future, occasionally do backups to prevent against loss. That has saved me more than once. :)


BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

content: OK, So let me ask this a different way. What steps do I need to take to recreate the local folders that I had with my old T-bird installation?
creator: dlwilliams15

content:
A simple approach would be to exit thunderbird and, using windows file explorer, copy the message files (the ones without the msf suffix) to the Mail\Local Folders folder of the active profile. But many people have trouble with that, so I suggest this:

  1. install the addon, importexporttools NG
  2. highlight the Local Folders folder
  3. rightclick and select the importexport option to import mbox file
  4. then, locate and select one of the message files
  5. repeat these steps for the remain message files
creator: davidsk

content: I installed the addon and followed steps 2 - 5. Worked like a charm. Thanks so much!

content:
> Brand new, fresh installation of Thunderbird. > 1. Added a GMail account. That worked. > 2. I tried to add an account with my personal domain. I enter my name, the email account, and Thunderbird gets stuck in an unending loop looking up the configuration.

I'm guessing that step #1 used the" traditional" account creation process, and step #2 used the new account hub seen at https://youtu.be/pstzLLZIk5c?t=247.

Does that sound correct?

Then you may be seeing https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1975860. The workaround is to uncheck "Create accounts in new the new Account Hub" in Settings.
creator: wsmwk

content: You can avoid the lookup process by adding the account in offline mode (click the icon at the left end of the status bar).
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you Wayne and sfhowes! Problem solved.

content:
The checkbox is not in the account hub.

Click on Settings in the top level menu. Then find "Create accounts in new the new Account Hub". Uncheck it. Now go create your account.
